title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to create a modern and efficient development dashboard. It leverages React Query for data fetching and focuses on providing a streamlined interface for managing and visualizing development-related information. This project serves as a practical example of integrating these technologies to build a robust and maintainable web application.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Python, designed as a project to visualize and interact with data from a Robofleet robotics system. This dashboard provides a user-friendly way to monitor robot status, view sensor data, and potentially control robot actions, offering a central hub for managing and understanding Robofleet deployments.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: This repository hosts a simple CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) expense tracker application built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, enhanced with Material-UI for a clean and responsive user interface. This project provides a practical example of implementing fundamental web development concepts, focusing on managing and visualizing personal finances through a user-friendly interface, making it a helpful resource for learning front-end development and CRUD operations.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [mention the core functionality or purpose based on README or known context, e.g., "creating a streamlined note-taking experience" or "building a robust data visualization platform"]. This repository contains the codebase for [mention key features or areas of focus, e.g., "the frontend application and associated utilities" or "the core data processing pipeline"]. It serves as a learning project and showcases [mention skills or techniques demonstrated, e.g., "modern front-end development practices" or "effective state management"].

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a project to explore and demonstrate dashboard development principles. It provides a foundation for creating interactive and data-rich user interfaces, leveraging Next.js's server-side rendering and routing capabilities for optimal performance and user experience.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a web-based project idea management tool built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, using the Next.js framework. It allows users to brainstorm, organize, and prioritize potential project ideas, fostering a collaborative environment for creative exploration and project planning. This repository showcases a practical application of modern web technologies for improving project ideation workflows.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. It provides a simple interface to track sleep patterns, calculate accumulated sleep debt, and offer insights into achieving optimal rest, leveraging modern web technologies for a user-friendly experience. This project explores practical applications of TypeScript within a front-end context.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations within a web application environment, leveraging the Flask framework to create a dynamic and interactive user experience while utilizing PostgreSQL for data persistence and shell scripting for automation tasks. This project aims to showcase proficiency in building full-stack applications with Python.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project utilizing HTML and Python to create interactive map visualizations. This repository focuses on building tools and techniques for representing geographical data and insights through dynamic maps, exploring topics related to data visualization and geographical analysis.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, implemented using LaTeX for the document structure and styling, and HTML for potential web-based presentation. It serves as a project showcasing my ability to create professional and customizable resumes, leveraging the power of TeX for precise formatting and HTML for wider accessibility.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project leveraging TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js to create a platform powered by the Gemini API. This application showcases the integration of modern web development technologies with AI, offering a user-friendly experience built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and provides a practical example of utilizing the Gemini API within a web application context.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains Python-based projects and Jupyter Notebooks focused on exploring various aspects of finance. Using Python libraries, it delves into topics like financial analysis, data visualization, and potentially algorithmic trading or portfolio management, offering practical examples and implementations for those interested in applying programming skills to financial concepts.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, enabling users to create and participate in polls. This project showcases modern web development practices, focusing on a streamlined user experience for creating and participating in voting events while leveraging a performant framework and statically typed language for maintainability and scalability.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a Next.js project for IoT asset tracking, leveraging Supabase for backend services and Tailwind CSS for styling. Built with TypeScript and JavaScript, this application provides a streamlined solution for monitoring and managing physical assets, incorporating modern web development practices and best-in-class frameworks. It aims to offer a user-friendly interface and robust functionality for tracking assets in real-time.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project demonstrating a dynamic and interactive event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository showcases how to create a visually appealing and functional calendar interface that can be easily customized and populated with event data, providing a flexible solution for scheduling and event management within web applications.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project allows users to easily parse, filter, and interpret ROS log data within a user-friendly interface, facilitating efficient debugging and performance analysis in robotics development.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on [Insert the specific purpose or goal of the project based on the README or what you know about it. Examples: showcasing interactive maps, visualizing global data, or creating a virtual world exploration experience]. This repository explores and implements [mention a key feature or functionality], leveraging modern web development practices.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a modern e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 using the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React Query for efficient data fetching and management. This project utilizes Material UI (MUI) for a responsive and accessible user interface, and focuses on providing a seamless shopping experience for purchasing fruits, showcasing best practices in type-safe front-end development.
